author: David A. Grogan
title: Ebay posts loss for holiday quarter as it books $3.1 billion tax charge
text:
Ebay posts loss for holiday quarter as it books $3.1 billion tax charge Ebay's net loss from continuing operations was $2.6 billion or $2.51 per share. The fourth-quarter loss included a $3.1 billion charge, while the prior-year quarter included a tax benefit of $4.6 billion. Published 21 Hours Ago 20 Hours Ago | 01:43 
Ebay posted a loss for the key holiday quarter on Wednesday as it booked a $3.1 billion charge from the recent changes in U.S. tax laws. 
EBay's net loss from continuing operations was $2.6 billion or $2.51 per share. A year-ago it earned $5.95 billion or $5.31 per share. 
The fourth-quarter loss included the charge, while the prior-year quarter included a tax benefit of $4.6 billion. 
Shares of eBay rose 2 percent in after-hours trading. Related Securities
